info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:37PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Larimer and central Boulder Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 136 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ward, or 37 miles northwest of Denver, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lyons, Nederland, Jamestown, Ward, Raymond, Brainard Lake, Allenspark, Crisman, Pinewood Springs, Gold Hill, Sunshine, Summerville, Peaceful Valley, Wallstreet, Salina and Carter Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
